question:
A student wishes to find the volume of a small, irregularly-shaped stone.A ruler and a measuring cylinder containing some water are available.
Which apparatus is needed?

answers.A: neither the ruler nor the measuring cylinder

answers.C: the ruler and the measuring cylinder

question: A ball is dropped from a table-top. Air resistance may be ignored. Which row describes the velocity and the acceleration of the ball at point X?

answers.A: neither the ruler nor the measuring cylinder

answers.C: the ruler and the measuring cylinder

question: The diagram shows the speed-time graph for a car. Which area represents the distance travelled while the car is accelerating?

answers.C: Y

question: Which quantities are measured in the same unit?

answers.B: energy and power, but not work

answers.C: energy and work, but not power

answers.D: power and work, but not energy

question:
Five identical bags of rice are balanced on a uniform beam by an object of mass 10kg. 
  Two more identical bags of rice are added to the other five. The average position of the bags on
the beam does not change. What mass now balances the bags?

answers.C: 12kg

question:
The diagram shows a cuboid block made from a metal of density 2.5g/ cm3
. What is the mass of the block?

The diagram shows an unbalanced rod. Two loads X and Y can be moved along the rod. The rod turns in a clockwise direction as shown.
Which action could make the rod balance?

answers.C: moving Y to the right

answers.D: moving the pivot to the left

question:
A box is being lifted by a fork-lift truck. The weight of the box is 3000N.
The force exerted by the fork-lift truck on the box is 3500N vertically upwards.
What is the resultant vertical force on the box?

answers.C: 6500N downwards

question:
The diagram shows a ball hanging on a string. The ball swings from point W to point Z and back
to point W. Which statement about the ball is correct?

answers.A: The kinetic energy of the ball is greatest at point W

answers.B: The kinetic energy of the ball is greatest at point X.

answers.C: The kinetic energy of the ball is greatest at point Y.

answers.D: The kinetic energy of the ball is the same at all points of the swing.

question: A person in a factory has to lift a box on to a shelf. Which action involves the person doing the least amount of work?

answers.A: lifting the box quickly to the high shelf

answers.B: lifting the box slowly to the high shelf

answers.C: lifting the box to the low shelf first then lifting it to the high shelf

answers.D: lifting the box to the low shelf instead of to the high shelf

question: Which is a non-renewable energy resource?

answers.C: tides

question:
The diagram shows a simple mercury barometer.
Which labelled length is measured when finding atmospheric pressure?

answers.C: tides

question:
Identical toy bricks are placed one on top of another to make a tower on a table.Which graph shows the relationship between the pressure P that the tower exerts on the table
and the weight W of the tower?

answers.C: tides

question:
The table lists the melting points and the boiling points of four different substances.
Which substance is a liquid at 0°C?

answers.C: tides

question:
Air in a sealed syringe is slowly compressed by moving the piston. The temperature of the air
stays the same.Which statement about the air is correct?

answers.A: The pressure of the air decreases because its molecules now travel more slowly.

answers.B: The pressure of the air decreases because the area of the syringe walls is now smaller.

answers.C: The pressure of the air increases because its molecules now hit the syringe walls more frequently.

answers.D: The pressure of the air increases because its molecules now travel more quickly.

question: Which quantity gives the thermal capacity of a solid object?

answers.A: the energy lost by radiation from the object in 1.0s

answers.B: the energy needed to melt the object

answers.C: the energy needed to raise the temperature of the object by 1.0°C

answers.D: the total amount of thermal energy in the object

question:
To mark a temperature scale on a thermometer, standard temperatures known as fixed points are
needed.
Which of these is a fixed point on the Celsius scale?

answers.C: the temperature of pure melting ice

answers.D: the temperature of pure warm water

question:
The diagram shows electricity cables being put up on a warm day. The cables are left loose
between the poles, as shown in the diagram. Why are the cables left loose?

answers.A: They will contract on cold days.

answers.B: They will contract on very warm days.

answers.C: They will expand on cold days.

answers.D: They will expand on very warm days.

question:
A cotton sheet is ironed with a hot electric iron.
How is energy transferred through the metal base of the iron to the sheet?

answers.C: by radiation only

question:
Two plastic cups are placed one inside the other. A small spacer keeps the two cups separated.
 Hot water is poured into the inner cup and a lid is put on top, as shown. Which statement is correct?

answers.A: The bench is heated by convection from the bottom of the outer cup.

answers.B: The lid reduces the energy lost by convection.

answers.C: There is no thermal conduction through the sides of either cup.

answers.D: Thermal radiation is prevented by the small air gap.

question:
A water wave in a shallow tank passes through a gap in a barrier. What happens to the speed and what happens to the wavelength of the wave as it passes
through the gap?

answers.A: The bench is heated by convection from the bottom of the outer cup.

answers.B: The lid reduces the energy lost by convection.

answers.C: There is no thermal conduction through the sides of either cup.

answers.D: Thermal radiation is prevented by the small air gap.

question: Which is a unit of wavelength?

answers.C: metre per second

question: Which diagram correctly shows a ray of light reflected by a plane mirror?

answers.A: The bench is heated by convection from the bottom of the outer cup.

answers.B: The lid reduces the energy lost by convection.

answers.C: There is no thermal conduction through the sides of either cup.

answers.D: Thermal radiation is prevented by the small air gap.

question:
A ray of white light is incident on a glass prism. Which ray diagram shows the ray as it passes through the prism and emerges from the opposite
side?

answers.A: P is louder and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.B: P is louder and lower in pitch than Q.

answers.C: P is quieter and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.D: P is quieter and lower in pitch than Q.

question:
A sound wave travels from a point X to another point Y. Which diagram represents the movement of the air molecules, due to the sound wave, in the
region between X and Y?

answers.A: P is louder and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.B: P is louder and lower in pitch than Q.

answers.C: P is quieter and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.D: P is quieter and lower in pitch than Q.

question:
Sound wave P has a greater amplitude and a larger wavelength in air than sound wave Q.
How do the loudness and pitch of P compare with the loudness and pitch of Q?

answers.A: P is louder and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.B: P is louder and lower in pitch than Q.

answers.C: P is quieter and higher in pitch than Q.

answers.D: P is quieter and lower in pitch than Q.

question: In which pair are both materials magnetic?

answers.C: iron and steel

question: The diagram shows the magnetic field around two bar magnets. Which diagram shows the poles of the magnets?

answers.C: a resistor

question: Which produces an electromotive force (e.m.f.)?

answers.C: a resistor

question:
The table describes four different resistance wires. They are all made from the same metal.
Which wire has the smallest resistance?

answers.C: between 60Ω and 100Ω

question:
Four lamps are each labelled 240V.
In which circuit do all four lamps have normal brightness?

answers.C: between 60Ω and 100Ω

question: The diagram shows a 40Ω resistor and a 60Ω resistor connected in parallel. What is the total resistance between points P and Q?

answers.C: between 60Ω and 100Ω

question:
The diagram shows a potential divider connected to two voltmeters P and Q. The resistance of the variable resistor is decreased.
Which row shows what happens to the reading on each voltmeter?

answers.C: an electric shock

question:
After some building work in a house, a bare (uninsulated) live wire is left protruding from a wall.
What is the greatest hazard?

answers.C: an electric shock

question:
A coil carries a current in a magnetic field. The coil experiences a turning effect.
Which device uses this effect?

answers.C: a relay

question:
A magnet is suspended from a spring so that it can move freely inside a stationary coil. The coil is
connected to a sensitive centre-zero galvanometer. The magnet repeatedly moves slowly up and down.
What does the galvanometer show?

answers.B: a steady reading to the left

answers.C: a steady reading to the right
